In precise, no-nonsense script, each card simply states the name of its cantrip, color-coded based on its school.

This pack contains 24 cards-one of each cantrip in the Core Rulebook.

Activate 1 or more (envision, Interact);

Effect You envision your desired cantrip, causing its card to rise to the top of the deck, and draw the card. The deck casts that cantrip as a 1st-level spell, with a DC of 15 and a spell attack modifier of +5. The card crumbles into dust as the cantrip takes effect. The activation takes the same number of actions as the cantrip you chose takes to cast.

  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gISYsBFby1TiXfBt]{Acid Splash}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.mAMEt4FFbdqoRnkN]{Chill Touch}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kl2q6JvBZwed4B6v]{Dancing Lights}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4gBIw4IDrSfFHik4]{Daze}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kcelf6IHl3L9VXXg]{Disrupt Undead}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qwZBXN6zBoB9BHXE]{Divine Lance}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kBhaPuzLUSwS6vVf]{Electric Arc}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.RA7VKcen3p56rVyZ]{Forbidding Ward}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.atlgGNI1E1Ox3O3a]{Ghost Sound}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.tXa5vOu5giBNCjdR]{Know Direction}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]{Mage Hand}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.vLzFcIaSXs7YTIqJ]{Message}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Qw3fnUlaUbnn7ipC]{Prestidigitation}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.OhD2Z6rIGGD5ocZA]{Read Aura}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.AUctDF2fqPZN2w4W]{Sigil}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.SnjhtQYexDtNDdEg]{Stabilize}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.uZK2BYzPnxUBnDjr]{Tanglefoot}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.60sgbuMWN0268dB7]{Telekinetic Projectile}

Compass (Lensatic).name: Compass (Lensatic)
Compass (Lensatic).description:
A compass helps you Sense Direction or navigate, provided you're in a location with uniform magnetic fields. Without a compass, you take a -2 item penalty to these checks (similar to using a shoddy item).

A lensatic compass gives you a +1 item bonus to these checks.

Automatically applied effects:

  • +1 item bonus to Survival checks to Sense Direction or navigate

Energy Mutagen (Greater).name: Energy Mutagen (Greater)
Energy Mutagen (Greater).description:
Activate A Interact

When created, this mutigen is attuned to one of four energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. When consumed, the mutagen suffuses your body with energy that spills out whenever you attack. At higher levels, it can even grant you the ability to unleash the energy in controlled bursts.

Benefit You gain resistance 15 to the attuned energy type. Whenever you score a hit with a melee weapon, add [[/r 1d6]] damage to the attuned energy type. In addition, you can end the benefits of this mutagen to unleash a 30-foot cone of energy that deals [[/r 2d6]] damage of the attuned type for every full 10 minutes of duration remaining (basic Reflex save).

Drawback You gain weakness 5 to the other three energy types.

Duration 1 hour.

Eagle Eye Elixir (Greater).name: Eagle Eye Elixir (Greater)
Eagle Eye Elixir (Greater).description:
Activate A Interact

After you drink this elixir, you notice subtle visual details. For the next hour, you gain a +3 item bonus to Perception checks, or +4 when attempting to find secret doors and traps.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.kgotU0sFmtAHYySB]{Effect: Eagle Eye Elixir (Greater)}

Drakeheart Mutagen (Moderate).name: Drakeheart Mutagen (Moderate)
Drakeheart Mutagen (Moderate).description:
Activate A Interact

Your skin grows tough scales like a drake, your eyesight become sharp and your pupils slitted, and your limbs grow wiry and quick, but your mind and reflexes become slow.

Benefit You gain +5 item bonus to AC, a Dexterity cap of +2 (as usual, use your lowest Dexterity cap if you have more than one), and a +2 item bonus to Perception checks. If you're wearing armor, you still calculate your proficiency bonus to AC based on your proficiency in the armor you're wearing, even if the drakeheart mutagen has a higher item bonus. You also gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EHa0owz6mccnmSBf]{Final Surge} action.

Drawback You take a -1 penalty to Will saves, Reflex saves, and all skill checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}.

Duration 10 minutes or until you use Final Surge, whichever comes first.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.BV8RPntjc9FUzD3g]{Effect: Drakeheart Mutagen (Moderate)}

Thunderbird Tuft (Major).name: Thunderbird Tuft (Major)
Thunderbird Tuft (Major).description:
Activate Cast a Spell (add 1 action)

This carved chunk of amber contains a single tuft of gray feathers, which spark with electricity to create an odd jittery sensation in anyone holding the amber for long. When used as part of a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.r3NeUnsgt9mS03Sn]{Shocking Grasp} spell, thunderbird tuft funnels electricity back into the spellcaster in a defensive nimbus. For 1 minute, any creature that touches you or that hits you with a melee unarmed attack or non-reach melee weapon attack takes [[/r {3d4}[electricity]]]{3d4 electricity damage}([[/r {3d6}[electricity]]]{3d6 electricity damage} if the creature is using a metal weapon).

Dwarven Daisy (Lesser).name: Dwarven Daisy (Lesser)
Dwarven Daisy (Lesser).description:
A dwarven daisy is a string of dozens of firecrackers that create tiny, loud explosions. The string ends with a short, wrapped fuse. Pulling off the wrapping in a quick motion lights the fuse and is done as part of the action to Strike. A dwarven daisy deals the listed fire damage and splash damage. A dwarven daisy also has a chance to dazzle its target. A creature struck by a dwarven daisy must succeed at a Fortitude save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Activate A Strike

The firework deals 1d6 fire damage and 1 fire splash damage. The DC is 16.

Wand of Overflowing Life (8th-Level Spel.name: Wand of Overflowing Life (8th-Level Spell)
Wand of Overflowing Life (8th-Level Spel.description:
This alabaster wand has a clear crystal at the tip.

Activate Cast a spell;

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge;

Effect You cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} at 8th level.

After you cast the spell, at the start of your next turn, excess healing magic wells up from the wand and heals you, as though you cast the 1-action version of heal on yourself at 3rd-level. You gain this benefit only once, even if you cast multiple heal spells from wands of overflowing life in the same turn.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of heal at 8th-level.

Thurible of Revelation (Lesser).name: Thurible of Revelation (Lesser)
Thurible of Revelation (Lesser).description:
This brass censer dangles on a length of chain. Most thuribles of revelation are adorned with swirling Celestial text, though some are iron and feature Infernal or Abyssal text.

Activate D Interact

Cost incense worth at least 5 gp

Effect You light the incense inside the censer, and it burns for 1 hour. During that time, as long you are holding the thurible, you gain a +1 item bonus to Religion checks, and any critical failure you roll when you Decipher Writing of a religious nature is a failure instead.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.lO95TwgihBdTilAB]{Effect: Thurible of Revelation}

Dazzling Rosary.name: Dazzling Rosary
Dazzling Rosary.description:
Activate Cast a Spell

When energy courses through these lustrous beads, they glow brightly in the sacred colors of the spellcaster's faith. A @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Fq9yCbqI2RDt6Orw]{Spiritual Weapon} empowered with this catalyst flashes with bright light when it critically Strikes a target, causing the target to be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the beginning of your next turn. The rosary can be used with a spiritual weapon of 4th level or below.

Staff of Final Rest (Greater).name: Staff of Final Rest (Greater)
Staff of Final Rest (Greater).description:
This white marble staff is carved into the figure of an abstract knight, its shield bearing the symbol of Lastwall, with a wickedly pointed sword made of dark wood raised high above its head. When you wield it as a weapon, it gains the versatile P trait and functions as a wooden stake, allowing you to use it to stake vampires, and your Strikes with the staff gain a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against undead.

Activate Cast a Spell;

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kcelf6IHl3L9VXXg]{Disrupt Undead}
  • 1st @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2iQKhCQBijhj5Rf3]{Disrupting Weapons}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}
  • 2nd @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Gentle Repose}
  • 3rd @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.GUeRTriJkMlMlVrk]{Bind Undead}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2iQKhCQBijhj5Rf3]{Disrupting Weapons}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}
  • 4th @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.DZ9bzXYqMjAK9TzC]{Holy Cascade}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

Dragon's Blood Pudding.name: Dragon's Blood Pudding
Dragon's Blood Pudding.description:
Activate 1 Interact

While some unscrupulous chefs claim that this savory pudding is made with real dragon's blood, its crimson color and acrid smell actually come from bloody mandrake paste, ginger root, and distilled terrap sap. This potent combination singes the nostrils and throat, removing effects that make you sluggish. When you consume the pudding, it attempts a counteract check with a [[/r {1d20+6}#Counteract Check]]{+6} counteract modifier to remove the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} condition from a single source, using the source of that condition to determine the counteract level and DC.

Dazzling Rosary (Greater).name: Dazzling Rosary (Greater)
Dazzling Rosary (Greater).description:
Activate Cast a Spell

When energy courses through these lustrous beads, they glow brightly in the sacred colors of the spellcaster's faith. A @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Fq9yCbqI2RDt6Orw]{Spiritual Weapon} empowered with this catalyst flashes with bright light when it critically Strikes a target, causing the target to be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the beginning of your next turn. The rosary can be used with a spiritual weapon of any level.

Blue Dragon's Breath Potion (Young).name: Blue Dragon's Breath Potion (Young)
Blue Dragon's Breath Potion (Young).description:
This liquid contains blood from a blue dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a blue dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a 30-foot line of electricity which deals [[/r {4d6}[electricity]]]{4d6 electricity damage}. All creatures in the area must attempt a basic Reflex save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Instant Evisceration Snare.name: Instant Evisceration Snare
Instant Evisceration Snare.description: When a creature enters the snare's square, the snare releases an unbelievable arsenal of blades, dealing 24d8 piercing damage (DC 45 basic Reflex).

Meteor Hammer.name: Meteor Hammer
Meteor Hammer.description: This weapon consists of a long chain connected to a heavy weight at one end. When a wielder swings the weight by the chain, it builds momentum and can serve as a deadly bludgeon with incredible reach.

Sovereign Steel Ingot.name: Sovereign Steel Ingot
Sovereign Steel Ingot.description:
Created by Black Sovereign Kevoth-Kul, this unique alloy of cold iron and the skymetal noqual can provide protection from magical assault. The process of cold-forging the two materials together is quite complicated and precise. Characters in search of sovereign steel weapons and armor will almost assuredly have to travel to Starfall to procure gear made from this rare alloy. While some believe it possible to craft shields of sovereign steel as well, in one of his fits, Kevoth-Kul yelled that he had no use for them and banned anyone from making such a thing. So far, his smiths have been too afraid to confirm whether or not it was a joke. All sovereign steel items (including weapon and armor below) have a +4 circumstance bonus on saves against magic that the item makes, and grant their bonus to saves the owner makes specifically to protect the item from magic (such as against the rusting grasp spell).

Sovereign Steel Items

Sovereign Steel Items Hardness HP BT
Thin Items
Standard-grade 7 28 14
High-grade 10 40 20
Items
Standard-grade

 11 44 22
High-grade

 14 56 28
Structure
Standard-grade

 22 88 44
High-grade

 28 112 56

Sight-Theft Grit.name: Sight-Theft Grit
Sight-Theft Grit.description:
Activate 1 Interact;

This blackish grit seems to absorb light and resembles particularly dark flakes of black pepper. Infused with the blindness spell, sight-theft grit causes the victim's sight to dim and then depart altogether. The @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} condition from this poison lasts for an additional 24 hours once the poison has run its course.

Saving Throw Fortitude;

Onset 10 minutes;

Maximum Duration 14 hours;

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and a -2 status penalty to visual Perception checks (1 hour);

Stage 2 dazzled and a -4 status penalty to visual Perception checks (1 hour);

Stage 3 blinded ([[/r 2d6 #hours]]{2d6 hours})

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.VosLNn2M8S7JH67D]{Blindness}.

Mentalist's Staff.name: Mentalist's Staff
Mentalist's Staff.description:
This polished wooden staff bears a swirling motif reminiscent of the folds of a brain. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify mental magic.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4gBIw4IDrSfFHik4]{Daze}
  • 1st @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.D442XMADp01qJ7Cs]{Mindlink} @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

Automatically applied effects:

  • +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify mental magic

Cloak of Repute (Greater).name: Cloak of Repute (Greater)
Cloak of Repute (Greater).description:
This gaudy and extravagant cloak is adorned with brilliant gems and a fur trim. While wearing the cloak, you gain instant fame and notoriety, granting you a +2 item bonus to Diplomacy checks to Make an Impression. Creatures attempting to learn about you gain the same bonus to Gather Information about you.

Activate D command

Frequency twice per day

Effect You wield your great stature to make a Request of a creature. If you roll a success on the check, you get a critical success instead.

Automatically applied effects:

  • +2 item bonus to Diplomacy checks to Make an Impression

Devil's Luck.name: Devil's Luck
Devil's Luck.description:
Devil @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.I4CpyMUsWfFYdpL5]{Imp};

Decipher Writing Arcana, Occultism, Society

You've bargained with an imp, one of the least powerful devils, for a fragment of infernal luck.

Benefit Once per day, you can roll a saving throw twice and use the higher result.

Payment At the termination of your mortal life, your soul must serve the imp for 100 years.

Hidden Condition The “termination of mortal life” clause is carefully worded to hasten your demise. You can't use the benefit against a death effect, and if you roll a failure on a saving throw against a death effect, you get a critical failure instead.

Termination Clause If you critically fail a saving throw against a death effect and do not die, the contract becomes unenforceable on its terms and is voided.

Blessed Tattoo.name: Blessed Tattoo
Blessed Tattoo.description:
Activate D envision, Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You gain the effect of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gMODOGamz88rgHuf]{Protection} against evil.

You can activate the tattoo as a reaction instead of a two-action activity, triggered when a demon attacks you or you attempt a saving throw against a demon's ability.

Miogimo's Mask.name: Miogimo's Mask
Miogimo's Mask.description:
The crime lord Miogimo almost always appears with this special mask, crafted with a piece of his soul.

It has two forms. In its first form, the mask depicts a silvery and angelic face; while wearing the mask in this form, your alignment appears as lawful good to creatures attempting to detect your alignment. In its second form, the mask depicts a gold-skinned demonic face; while wearing the mask in this form, your alignment appears as chaotic evil to creatures attempting to detect your alignment. If you die while wearing the mask, a fragment of your soul is trapped in the mask, forming a life link. If there was already a soul fragment in the mask when this happens, you roll a Will save against the Will DC of the person who left the previous fragment. If you succeed, your soul fragment replaces the old one. On a failure, you die normally.

Activate1 envision

Effect You switch the mask to its other form.

Activate2 envision

Frequency once per day

Effect You cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.3x6eUCm17n6ROzUa]{Crisis of Faith} (Will), targeting up to four creatures within 30 feet. If the mask is in its angelic form, you can target only evil and neutral creatures. If the mask is in its demonic form, you can target only good and neutral creatures.

Activate 10 minutes (command, envision, Interact)

Requirements A soul fragment is in the mask

Effect You cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.FM3SmEW8N1FCRjqt]{Talking Corpse} on the soul fragment, except you communicate telepathically and don't require the fragment's body to speak.

Artisan's Tools.name: Artisan's Tools
Artisan's Tools.description: You need these tools to create items from raw materials with the Craft skill. Different sets are needed for different work, as determined by the GM; for example, blacksmith's tools differ from woodworker's tools.

Sunrod.name: Sunrod
Sunrod.description:
Activate A Interact

This 1-foot-long, gold-tipped rod glows after it's struck on a hard surface. For the next 6 hours, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet).

Wand of Manifold Missiles (5th-Level Spe.name: Wand of Manifold Missiles (5th-Level Spell)
Wand of Manifold Missiles (5th-Level Spe.description:
This wand features a carved dragon's head at its top and a polished metal sphere set in its midsection.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Magic Missile} at 5th level.

After you cast the spell, an additional missile or missiles are released from the wand at the start of each of your turns, as though you cast the 1-action version of magic missile. Choose targets each time. This lasts for 1 minute, until you're no longer wielding the wand, or until you try to activate the wand again.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of magic missile of the appropriate level.

Rune of Sin.name: Rune of Sin
Rune of Sin.description: This jagged glyph, one of the Thassilonian runes of sin, reacts to magic of a particular school (there's no rune for divination, as it was considered lesser within sin magic). When you Cast a Spell of the school matching the sin, you gain resistance 5 to damage from spells until the start of your next turn. This resistance is increased to 7 against spells of the matching school. This tattoo has the school trait matching the rune: abjuration for envy, necromancy for gluttony, transmutation for greed, enchantment for lust, illusion for pride, conjuration for sloth, and evocation for wrath.

Skittering Mask (Greater).name: Skittering Mask (Greater)
Skittering Mask (Greater).description:
This carved wooden full-head mask sports several holes along each side of the face. The first time each day that you begin your turn unconscious and within 25 feet of an enemy, metallic insect legs emerge from the holes in the mask and Step 15 feet away from the nearest enemy, dragging your body along with the mask. For 1 minute, each time you begin your turn unconscious and within 25 feet of an enemy, the mask Steps 15 feet away from the nearest enemy again. An ally can signal the mask with a single action, which has the auditory and concentrate traits. If the mask hears the signal, it attempts to move you towards that ally when it Steps away from the nearest enemy.

If more than one enemy is equidistant, the mask Steps away from one of them at random. The mask possesses no special senses and does not react to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} enemies, nor can it distinguish that a creature not acting openly hostile is an enemy.

Dragonbone Arrowhead.name: Dragonbone Arrowhead
Dragonbone Arrowhead.description:
Usage affixed to a melee weapon or a ranged weapon with the thrown trait;

Activate 1 Interact;

Requirements You're an expert with the affixed weapon.

This arrowhead, carved from dragon bone, hangs off the shaft of your weapon. When you activate this talisman, until the end of the current turn, the affixed weapon gains the thrown 20 feet weapon trait, and when you make a thrown Strike with it, it flies back to your hand after the Strike completes. If your hands are full when the weapon returns, it falls to the ground in your space.

Crimson Fulcrum Lens.name: Crimson Fulcrum Lens
Crimson Fulcrum Lens.description:
This concave lens has a drifting crimson cloud resembling slowly swirling blood within it. While you have the Crimson Fulcrum Lens invested, you seethe with malevolent fury you can barely contain. You gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws against fear effects and a +2 item bonus to your melee Strike damage (this increases to a +4 item bonus to damage if the melee Strike is a jaws attack). You can also activate the lens in the following ways.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.ytqvHyF0oMKbo65P]{Effect: Crimson Fulcrum Lens}

Activate 2 Interact;

Frequency once per day;

Effect You grasp the Crimson Fulcrum Lens in one hand and make a Strike that doesn't require that hand. The Strike deals an additional 1d8 precision damage (or 2d8 precision damage if you make a jaws Strike) and doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty.

Activate 2 Interact (attack, possession);

Effect While grasping the lens, make a melee spell attack roll with a modifier of +18. On a hit, you force the splinter of Nhimbaloth's essence from the lens to possess the target. You're no longer invested in the lens, and the target gains the benefits as though it had invested the lens but can't activate the lens's other abilities. This effect is permanent, but it can be ended by any effect that removes a possession effect. The lens doesn't have any magical abilities until the possession effect ends; when it does, the essence returns to the lens.

Potion of Acid Resistance (Moderate).name: Potion of Acid Resistance (Moderate)
Potion of Acid Resistance (Moderate).description:
Drinking this thick, fortifying potion grants resistance 10 against acid damage for 1 hour.

Activate A Interact

Nightmare Cudgel.name: Nightmare Cudgel
Nightmare Cudgel.description:
Crafted from polished wood, this seemingly mundane +1 striking @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.c58wczIzH2gzeXQL]{Club} comes with a red leather strap near the handle. The mere sight of the cudgel in a guard's hand fills prisoners with dread.

Good creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} while carrying, wielding, or wearing this item crafted by the sea-witches.

Activate2 Interact (emotion, mental)

Frequency once per day

Effect You initiate an intimidating walk, thumping the cudgel menacingly against your palm. As part of activating this item, you can Stride twice. For the next minute, whenever you successfully Strike a creature with the nightmare cudgel, you can use a free action to attempt an Intimidation check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the struck creature.

Dust of Corpse Animation (Greater).name: Dust of Corpse Animation (Greater)
Dust of Corpse Animation (Greater).description:
Activate 2 Interact

This black pouch contains what appears to be fine bone dust. Pouring the dust in a special pattern over a corpse turns it into an undead creature. The type of undead created depends on the condition of the corpse, resulting in either a skeleton or a zombie. If the undead's level would be greater than 11, the dust fails to animate it. The body must be of an appropriate size and type for the undead you wish to create-for example, you must sprinkle the dust on a horse's skeleton to animate a skeletal horse. If more than one undead in the level range is appropriate, such as skeletal guard or skeletal champion for a Medium humanoid skeleton, you choose.

The animated undead has the minion trait, meaning it can use 2 actions when you Command it. You can issue a Command for the current turn as part of the activation. The undead creature remains animated for 1 minute before collapsing back into its corpse form. As usual, you can have a maximum of four minions under your control.

Sulfur Bomb (Major).name: Sulfur Bomb (Major)
Sulfur Bomb (Major).description:
Activate 1 Strike

A thick, sulfurous, irritating gas fills this golden‑yellow flask. A sulfur bomb deals the listed damage. On a hit, the target takes a -1 status penalty to Perception checks and attack rolls until the end of its next turn, or becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} on a critical hit. Creatures hit with this bomb are temporarily immune to the effects of the bomb for 1 minute.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.fuQVJiPPUsvL6fi5]{Effect: Sulfur Bomb (Failure)}

Grim Sandglass (Greater).name: Grim Sandglass (Greater)
Grim Sandglass (Greater).description:
One bulb of this tiny hourglass contains black sand, the other white. After even a few grains pass from one side to the other, it reverses its flow to keep the two sides in equilibrium. The spell DC of any spell cast by Activating this item is 24.

  • Armor You gain resistance 5 to negative.
  • Weapon After you cast a necromancy spell by Activating the sandglass, your Strikes with the weapon deal an additional 1d6 negative damage until the end of your next turn.

Activate Cast a Spell;

Effect You cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.mAMEt4FFbdqoRnkN]{Chill Touch}.

Activate Cast a Spell;

Frequency once per day;

Effect You cast 2nd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}.

Thunder Snare.name: Thunder Snare
Thunder Snare.description:
The snare makes a thunderous noise when a creature enters the snare's square, which can be heard up to 1,000 feet away. The creature must attempt a Fortitude saving throw.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is deafened until the end of its next turn.

Failure As success, and the target also takes 1 sonic damage.

Critical Failure As success, and the target also takes 1d4 sonic damage.

Craft Requirements 1 lesser thunderstone

Wind and Fire Wheel.name: Wind and Fire Wheel
Wind and Fire Wheel.description: This large, flat steel ring features several protruding blades typically stylized to resemble flames.

Wand of Teeming Ghosts (2nd-Level Spell).name: Wand of Teeming Ghosts (2nd-Level Spell)
Wand of Teeming Ghosts (2nd-Level Spell).description:
This pale wooden wand is carved to resemble a thigh bone with metal caps at each end. Ghostly tendrils seem to swirl around it every so often.

Activate @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell};

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge;

Effect You cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8ViwItUgwT4lOvvb]{False Life} at 2nd level. During the duration of the spell, wisps that resemble spirits flit around you as long as you have any temporary Hit Points from false life, and you can use the following action.

Activation F envision;

Trigger You successfully impart the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} condition to a creature;

Requirements You have temporary Hit Points;

Effect You end false life and increase the creature's frightened condition value to 2.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of False Life at 2nd level

Fulu of Concealment.name: Fulu of Concealment
Fulu of Concealment.description:
Usage affixed to the ground in four spaces along a 10-foot radius circle;

Duration 1 hour

This fulu comes in four pieces, one placed in each cardinal direction. Choose one of the following traits when Activating the fulus: animal, beast, celestial, fey, fiend, humanoid, monitor, plant, or undead. Those within the fulus' circle upon activation (including the fulus themselves) gain the effect of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.I0j56TNRmGcTyoqJ]{Invisibility Sphere}, but only against creatures with the chosen trait. If any of the fulus are moved or destroyed after activation, the effect ends.

Salve of Antiparalysis (Greater).name: Salve of Antiparalysis (Greater)
Salve of Antiparalysis (Greater).description:
A greater salve of antiparalysis can potentially remove petrification. The creature recovers as if it were the target of both a 6th-level remove paralysis spell and a stone to flesh spell.

Activate A Interact

Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).name: Alchemist's Fire (Lesser)
Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 1d8 fire damage, 1 persistent fire damage, and 1 fire splash damage.

Floating Shield.name: Floating Shield
Floating Shield.description:
A floating shield is usually carved with wing motifs. This buckler (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) can protect you on its own.

Activate A Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect The shield magically releases itself and floats off your arm into the air next to you, granting you its bonus automatically, as if you had Raised the Shield.

Because you're not wielding the shield, you can't use reactions such as Shield Block with the shield, but you gain its benefits even when using both of your hands.

After 1 minute, the shield drops to the ground, ending its floating effect. While the shield is adjacent to you, you can Interact to grasp it, ending its floating effect early.

Dimensional Knot.name: Dimensional Knot
Dimensional Knot.description:
Activate Cast a Spell

Shelynites originally crafted this complex knot of vibrant string for bracelets meant to tie the destinies of two people together. Now, however, spellcasters of all religions use them to enhance their capacity with teleportation magic. Adding this catalyst to a 4th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Dimension Door} spell allows you to bring a single willing adjacent creature along with you; however, the teleportation is somewhat disorienting for them, causing them to become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Sickle-saber.name: Sickle-saber
Sickle-saber.description: A classical weapon of Irrisenis who lacked magical talent, the sickle-saber has seen a resurgence since the coronation of Queen Anastasia. The queen was fascinated with the sickle-sabers in the palace treasury, and now the unusual blades are carried by her honor guard and Irriseni diplomats alike. The sickle‑saber's blade curves multiple times along its 4‑foot length, and its hilt is similarly curved. A small, secondary grip on the blade lets the wielder rapidly and unpredictably twist the cutting edges. Characters from Irrisen have access to the sickle-saber.

Heartstone.name: Heartstone
Heartstone.description:
This gemstone grants its wearer a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

Each heartstone is powered by the spirit of a specific night hag. If it's separated from her for 24 hours (or she's been dead for 24 hours), it becomes a nonmagical gemstone. A heartstone allows the hag to use additional occult innate spells: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt} (9th level) and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Bind Soul} at will, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.IqJ9URobmJ9L9UBG]{Shadow Blast} twice per day.

Activate A command

Requirements You must be touching the heartstone.

Effect The heartstone attempts to counteract one disease affecting you (counteract level 5, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+18]]).

Craft Requirements You must be a night hag.

Automatically applied effects:

  • +2 item bonus to saving throws

Vaccine (Minor).name: Vaccine (Minor)
Vaccine (Minor).description:
Activate 1 Interact

A vaccine grants a creature immunity to a specific strain of disease of a level equal to or less than the vaccine's level, and a +2 item bonus on all saving throws against other strains of the same disease. For example, a vaccine could grant immunity to filth fever inflicted by otyughs, but would only grant a +2 saving throw bonus against filth fever inflicted by a giant rat.

Craft Requirements Creating a vaccine requires a sample of the disease in question.

Duration 1 hour.

Staff of the Desert Winds.name: Staff of the Desert Winds
Staff of the Desert Winds.description:
This crooked staff is made from twisting acacia wood and has a sphere of rough sandstone embedded in the top, to channel the magic of the desert. When wielding this staff in deserts, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks to Subsist, Track, and Cover Tracks.

Activate Cast a Spell;

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from the staff's list.

  • Cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.tXa5vOu5giBNCjdR]{Know Direction}
  • 1st @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WzLKjSw6hsBhuklC]{Create Water}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.zlnXpME1T2uvn8Lr]{Pass Without Trace}
  • 2nd @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.5esP2GVzvxWsMgaX]{Endure Elements}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rdTEF1hfAWbN58NE]{Enhance Victuals}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells

Rune of Sin (Sloth).name: Rune of Sin (Sloth)
Rune of Sin (Sloth).description: This jagged glyph, the sloth Thassilonian rune of sin, reacts to conjuration magic. When you Cast a conjuration Spell, you gain resistance 5 to damage from spells until the start of your next turn. This resistance is increased to 7 against conjuration spells.

Verdant Staff (Greater).name: Verdant Staff (Greater)
Verdant Staff (Greater).description:
This oak branch grows leaves in spring that change color in autumn and shed in winter. While wielding it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to identify plants.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrips @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.uZK2BYzPnxUBnDjr]{Tanglefoot}
  • 1st @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.s3abwDbTV43pGFFW]{Shillelagh} (can target the verdant staff)
  • 2nd @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.YWrfKetOqDwVFut7]{Barkskin}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{Entangle}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.CXICME10TkEJxz0P]{Shape Wood}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{Tree Shape}
  • 3rd @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns}
  • 4th @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.YWrfKetOqDwVFut7]{Barkskin}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qvwIwJ9QBihy8R0t]{Speak with Plants}
  • 5th @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.zCcfPS4y5SrZzU2x]{Plant Form}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

Automatically applied effects:

  • +2 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to identify plants

Tindertwig.name: Tindertwig
Tindertwig.description:
Activate A Interact

An alchemical substance applied to one end of this tiny wooden stick ignites when struck against a rough surface. Creating a flame with a tindertwig is much faster than creating a flame with flint and steel. You can ignite the tindertwig and touch it to a flammable object as part of the same Interact action.

Sickle.name: Sickle
Sickle.description: Originally a farming tool used for reaping grain, this one‑handed weapon has a short wooden handle ending in a curved blade, sometimes sharpened on both sides.

Small cold iron cauldron with onyx.name: Small cold iron cauldron with onyx

Ganjay Book (Light bulk book).name: Ganjay Book (Light bulk book)
Ganjay Book (Light bulk book).description:
This item is a formula book, religious text, or spellbook that has been creased-possibly by Princess Ganjay herself-to fold up into an impossibly small shape. When folded up, the book can't be read or used, but its Bulk is reduced by 1 (a book that is 1 Bulk becomes light Bulk, and a book that is light Bulk becomes negligible in weight).

Activate 1 minute (Interact) You fold or unfold the Ganjay book, manipulating the cunning creases.

Musical Instrument (Virtuoso heavy).name: Musical Instrument (Virtuoso heavy)
Musical Instrument (Virtuoso heavy).description:
Handheld instruments include bagpipes, a small set of chimes, small drums, fiddles and viols, flutes and recorders, small harps, lutes, trumpets, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a tuba) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as large drums, a full set of chimes, and keyboard instruments are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played. A virtuoso instrument gives a +1 item bonus to Performance checks using that instrument.

Automatically applied effects:

  • +1 item bonus to Performance checks using that instrument.

Potion of Resistance (Greater).name: Potion of Resistance (Greater)
Potion of Resistance (Greater).description: Drinking this thick, fortifying potion grants 15 resistance against a single damage type for 1 hour. Each potion of resistance is created to defend against acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage (and is called a lesser potion of fire resistance or the like).

Religious Text.name: Religious Text
Religious Text.description: This manuscript contains scripture of a particular religion. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious text as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious text must be held in one hand to use it.

Hype.name: Hype
Hype.description:
Activate 1 Interact

A synthetic adrenaline supplement that increases awareness and reaction time.

Saving Throw Fortitude;

Maximum Duration 1 minute;

Stage 1 quickened and can use the additional action to Step or Stride (1 round);

Stage 2 stupefied 2 (1 round);

Stage 3 drained 2 and stupefied 2 (1 round)

Shining Wayfinder.name: Shining Wayfinder
Shining Wayfinder.description:
A shining wayfinder is a polished silver compass blessed by the power of benevolent deities. It has the usual functions of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.gbwr57aT9ou8yKWT]{Wayfinder}, except instead of an activation to cast light, the shining wayfinder has the following two activations.

Activate 2 command, Interact

Effect You hold the wayfinder and ask for guidance. The wayfinder casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance} on you.

Activate 2 command, Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You call upon the wayfinder's divine blessings for yourself and your allies. The wayfinder casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.XSujb7EsSwKl19Uu]{Bless}, with an emanation centered on itself. Once per turn, you can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet.

Slumber Wine.name: Slumber Wine
Slumber Wine.description:
Slumber wine sees its greatest use in games of intrigue, where an absence can be more devastating than injury. Characters unconscious from slumber wine can't wake up by any means while the poison lasts, don't need to eat or drink while unconscious in this way, and appear to be recently dead unless an examiner succeeds at a DC 40 Medicine check.

Activate A Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw Fortitude

Onset 1 hour

Maximum Duration 7 days

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 2 unconscious (2 days)

Stage 3 unconscious (3 days)

Padded Armor.name: Padded Armor
Padded Armor.description: This armor is simply a layer of heavy, quilted cloth, but it is sometimes used because it's so inexpensive. Padded armor is easier to damage and destroy than other types of armor. Heavy armor comes with a padded armor undercoat included in its Price, though it loses the comfort trait when worn under heavy armor. You can wear just that padded armor or undercoat to sleep in, if your heavy armor is destroyed, or when otherwise not wearing the full heavy armor. This allows you to keep the armor invested and benefit from the power of any runes on the associated heavy armor, but no one else can wear your heavy armor without the padded undercoat.

Barkskin Potion.name: Barkskin Potion
Barkskin Potion.description: After you drink this bitter draft, your skin thickens like bark. You gain the effects of a 2nd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.YWrfKetOqDwVFut7]{Barkskin} spell for 10 minutes.

Potion of Cold Retaliation (Minor).name: Potion of Cold Retaliation (Minor)
Potion of Cold Retaliation (Minor).description:
Activate 1 Interact

For 1 minute after drinking a potion of cold retaliation, you glow with a faint aura of cold energy, and a creature that touches you (such as by making an unarmed attack or using a spell with a range of touch against you) takes cold damage.

The aura deals 1 cold damage.

Bloodbane (Greater).name: Bloodbane (Greater)
Bloodbane (Greater).description:
A bloodbane clan dagger is especially vicious against the ancestral enemies of the clan. When you damage an appropriate type of creature with the weapon, that creature takes [[/r 1d4 #persistent bleed]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}. The type of creature depends on the clan that made the dagger, but is typically drow, duergar, giant, or orc.

In addition, whenever you inflict persistent bleed damage with a bloodbane weapon (whether from its innate ability or in some other way), the weapon leaves ragged wounds. The bleeding creature must succeed at a Fortitude save or become sickened 1. The creature is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Server's Stew.name: Server's Stew
Server's Stew.description:
Activate 1 Interact

The type of animal tongue used in this tomato-based stew shifts from region to region, but it's always cooked with spirit of wine and seasoned with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Vy3z2cIQ8uJRUMYw]{Refined Pesh}. Eating this restaurant-staff favorite empowers you to speak and understand a single language for 1 hour. This must be a language the stew's cook could speak and understand, chosen at the time of the stew's creation. It also helps your words land smoothly, granting you a +2 item bonus to Diplomacy checks made in that language for the same duration. It doesn't allow you to read the newly acquired language in its written form.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.ehYmO1rFBt35zoOw]{Effect: Server's Stew}

Hammer Gun.name: Hammer Gun
Hammer Gun.description: This weapon, favored by dwarves and those who like smashing and shooting, takes the form of a stoutly built gun designed similarly to an arquebus with a hammer head built into the muzzle, decreasing kickback but limiting range.

Clockwork Helm.name: Clockwork Helm
Clockwork Helm.description:
Rotating gears cover the outside of this imposing helmet.

In order to function, the device must be wound for 10 minutes once every 24 hours. The clockwork helm has a calming and focusing effect on the mind. If you're affected by a detrimental condition caused by a mental or emotion effect, each round at the beginning of your turn, the gears of the helmet unwind and reduce the value of the condition by 1. This effect works only if the condition's value can normally be reduced by simply waiting; otherwise the helmet has no effect.

Activate2 envision

Frequency once per day

Requirements You've wound the clockwork helm for 10 minutes within the last 24 hours

Effect You fire a beam of withering heat from the helmet's eye slits at a target. Make a spell or ranged attack roll (your choice) to affect the target. On a hit, the target takes [[/r {10d8}[fire]]]{10d8 fire damage} and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Tar Rocket Snare.name: Tar Rocket Snare
Tar Rocket Snare.description:
You coat a small firework with a thick layer of resin and tar, so it sticks firmly onto a target. When a creature enters the square, the rocket launches at the creature and potentially sticks to it. You determine the direction the rocket faces when crafting the snare. The triggering creature must attempt a Reflex save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is dealt a glancing blow by the rocket and becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the start of its next turn.

Failure The rocket's coating of tar and resin sticks to the creature, and it can't be shaken loose. The creature becomes flat-footed for 1 round, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute or until it Escapes (DC 20).

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature takes a direct hit. It takes [[/r {2d6}[bludgeoning]]]{2d6 bludgeoning damage} and is pushed 10 feet in the direction the rocket faces.

Bravo's Brew (Lesser).name: Bravo's Brew (Lesser)
Bravo's Brew (Lesser).description:
Activate A Interact

This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain a +1 item bonus to Will saves, or +2 when attempting Will saves against fear.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.eh7EqmDBDW30ShCu]{Effect: Bravo's Brew (Lesser)}

Tricky Pick.name: Tricky Pick
Tricky Pick.description: This ingenious kobold pick conceals several hidden traps, which the wielder can activate to trick and befuddle foes with a variety of damaging blades and bludgeoning surfaces.

Forgotten Shell.name: Forgotten Shell
Forgotten Shell.description:
This +2 resilient @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Gq1cZWSKOtJhKd2p]{Full Plate}, crafted from grim plates of iron, covers the entire body except for small holes for the eyes and mouth.

While wearing the armor, you gain the benefits of a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Nondetection} spell. Additionally, creatures attempting to Recall Knowledge about a subject involving you must succeed at a Will. On a success, they can attempt the check normally. On a failure, they can still attempt the check, but even if they successfully Recall Knowledge, they don't remember you (although they might remember other details about the event). Creatures that fail their save can make another attempt to Recall Knowledge about you, but they must wait 24 hours to do so.

You can spend 1 hour using blacksmithing tools to bind a helpless Medium humanoid inside the suit, which welds the suit shut and makes it impossible to remove without breaking it (Hardness 9, HP 36, BT 18). The humanoid inside the suit counts as being Invested while bound in this fashion and can't break out of the suit on its own. If the suit is welded shut, the creature gains the benefits above but also the following penalties:

  • Whenever the humanoid attempts a Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, or Performance check, they must roll twice and use the worse result.
  • Additionally, creatures the humanoid encounters have an initial attitude toward them of one degree worse than they normally would (for instance, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.I1ffBVISxLr2gC4u]{Unfriendly} instead of @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fuG8dgthlDWfWjIA]{Indifferent}).
  • Good creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} while carrying, wielding, or wearing this item crafted by the sea-witches.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of Nondetection and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}.

Pendant of the Occult.name: Pendant of the Occult
Pendant of the Occult.description:
This amulet is hollow and shaped in the form of an unblinking eye. Its cavity typically holds some fragment of occult text. While wearing the pendant, you gain a +1 item bonus to Occultism checks, and you can cast the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance} cantrip as an occult innate spell.

Automatically applied effects:

  • +1 item bonus to Occultism checks

Blue Dragon's Breath Potion (Adult).name: Blue Dragon's Breath Potion (Adult)
Blue Dragon's Breath Potion (Adult).description:
This liquid contains blood from a blue dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a blue dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a 30-foot line of electricity which deals [[/r {6d6}[electricity]]]{6d6 electricity damage}. All creatures in the area must attempt a basic Reflex save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Kama.name: Kama
Kama.description: Similar to a sickle and used in some regions to reap grain, a kama has a short, slightly curved blade and a wooden handle.

Wand of Smoldering Fireballs (5th-Level.name: Wand of Smoldering Fireballs (5th-Level Spell)
Wand of Smoldering Fireballs (5th-Level.description:
This blackened, heavily burned stick smells faintly of bat guano.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} at 5th level.

Each creature that fails its save takes [[/r 2d6 #persistent fire]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of fireball of the appropriate level.

Wand of Widening (4th-Level Spell).name: Wand of Widening (4th-Level Spell)
Wand of Widening (4th-Level Spell).description:
The end of this wand is forked instead of tapered.

Activate Cast a Spell; The activation takes 2 if the spell normally takes 1 to cast, or 3 if the spell normally take 2

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell, and increase its area. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet; add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller; or add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of a spell of the appropriate level. The spell must have a casting time of 1 or 2, can't have a duration, and must have an area of burst (10 feet or more), cone, or line.

Habu's Cudgel.name: Habu's Cudgel
Habu's Cudgel.description:
Long associated with a notorious crime boss in Nantambu, this stout +1 striking fearsome club is studded with vicious-looking knobs of obsidian and wrapped in cloth for a better grip. It emits a ghastly groan when swung.

Activate 2 Interact;

Frequency once per day;

Effect You gesture at a square within 40 feet with Habu's Cudgel. The club causes a frightful wail to unleash from that square and casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear} (Will) targeting the creature in that square and all adjacent creatures.

Sea Touch Elixir (Lesser).name: Sea Touch Elixir (Lesser)
Sea Touch Elixir (Lesser).description:
Activate A Interact

This briny concoction alters the skin on your hands and feet. The spaces between your fingers and toes become webbed, granting you a swim Speed of 20 feet for 10 minutes.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.thOpQunbQr77XWdF]{Effect: Sea Touch Elixir (Lesser)}

Class Kit (Investigator).name: Class Kit (Investigator)
Class Kit (Investigator).description:
Armor studded leather armor
Weapons sap, shortsword, crossbow with 20 bolts
Gear adventurer's pack, crowbar
Options @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.4ftXXUCBHcf4b0MH]{Alchemist's Tools} (3 gp), @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.ckGYDocGEaelHfXF]{Manacles (Simple)} (3 gp), @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.QJb8S927Yj81EgHH]{Writing Set} (1 gp)

Repeating Hand Crossbow.name: Repeating Hand Crossbow
Repeating Hand Crossbow.description: This handheld crossbow features an ingeniously designed catch mechanism at the top of the flight groove, just in front of the latch, which automatically loads a bolt from a magazine and resets the string each time the weapon is fired. A typical repeating hand crossbow magazine holds five bolts.

Spiked Chain.name: Spiked Chain
Spiked Chain.description: This 4‑foot‑long length of chain is covered with barbs and has spikes on one or both ends. Some feature metal hoops used as handgrips.

Nine-Ring Sword.name: Nine-Ring Sword
Nine-Ring Sword.description: This sword has a broad blade, along which are threaded nine heavy metal rings. The rings add weight to the weapon for downward swings, as well as clashing together to make noise.

Lethargy Poison.name: Lethargy Poison
Lethargy Poison.description:
Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by drow and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw Fortitude

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 slowed 1 (1 minute)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 round)

Stage 4 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up ([[/br 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}).

Tiger Menuki.name: Tiger Menuki
Tiger Menuki.description:
Activate F Envision

Trigger You Strike with the affixed weapon

This tiger formed of pewter snarls viciously from your weapon's grip. When you activate the tiger, the affixed weapon gains the sweep trait for the triggering attack and all other attacks for 1 minute.

Thieves' Tools.name: Thieves' Tools
Thieves' Tools.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

Ring of Energy Resistance (Major).name: Ring of Energy Resistance (Major)
Ring of Energy Resistance (Major).description: This ring grants you resistance 15 against one type of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. Each ring is crafted to protect against a particular type of energy damage, and its design usually embodies the type of energy it protects the wearer from in some way. For instance, a ring of fire resistance might be capped with a ruby, whereas a ring of cold resistance features a sapphire instead.
